definition: to know the facts/to understand/to be familiar with the situation
see 通情達理|通情达理[tong1 qing2 da2 li3]

sentences.english: According to informed sources, "the Deputy Editor-in-Chief" is an administrative level.
sentences.chinese: 據知情人士說，“副總編輯”是一個行政級別。

sentences.english: You think I'm just withholding information because I like hanging out with you?
sentences.chinese: 你以爲我會知情不報只爲了和你聊天？

sentences.english: Methods The ink print of fingerprint and palmar patterns were obtained with informed consent.
sentences.chinese: 方法在知情同意手續下，捺印調查對象的手紋。

sentences.english: Informed consent should not be a mere contract for research participants to sign.
sentences.chinese: 知情同意不應該僅僅是一個讓研究參與者簽署的合同。

sentences.english: Do not know because the Theis pool in Beichen that caused the contradiction and anlin.
sentences.chinese: 不知情的泰斯因爲池北辰的表白，而與安霖產生矛盾。

sentences.english: There were monkeys up in the tree. The hat marker did not know this.
sentences.chinese: 樹上有猴子，帽匠對此並不知情。

sentences.english: The French and U.S. companies said they knew nothing of the case.
sentences.chinese: 這家法國公司與泰科公司均稱對此毫不知情。

sentences.english: But insiders still reckon the two mega-mergers will go ahead.
sentences.chinese: 不過知情人士仍兩大公司的合併會下去。

sentences.english: Better, to some extent, not to know.
sentences.chinese: 在某種程度上，最好不知情。

sentences.english: Some informed estimates place Iraqi civilian casualities at over 600,000.
sentences.chinese: 有些知情者估計伊拉克死亡市民人數高達60萬以上。
18歲的人能夠給予知情同意嗎？

sentences.english: Ms. Khan wasn't rehired, said a person familiar with the matter.
sentences.chinese: 知情人士說，肯恩沒有被重新僱用。

sentences.english: Informed consent right was one of the patients legal rights in the medical activities.
sentences.chinese: 知情同意權是患者在醫療活動中享有的一項法定權利。

sentences.english: But personage of know the inside story thinks, this coverts namely actually leave one's post.
sentences.chinese: 但有知情人士認爲，這實際上就是變相離職。

sentences.english: He is simply not aware of any talks between the two firms, she said.
sentences.chinese: 她表示沃克只是對兩個公司的任何談判都不知情。

sentences.english: Secondly, should focus on building a long-term protection of the right to know potential buyer integrated mechanism.
sentences.chinese: 其次，應着力構建預購人知情權保護的長效綜合機制。

definition: lit. kept inside a drum (idiom)/fig. completely in the dark
to be in charge/to be confronted (with a matter)/involved (in some matter)
to consider as a matter of importance/to be of importance
to turn out to be true/verified/true
to conceal/to hide (a taboo subject)/to cover up the truth
